TextBody:
Hello Jay,

Thanks for reaching out!

1. To increase the number of displayed items, please open the console and navigate to Device Control -> Global Settings


Scroll to the bottom of the page and set "Maximum no. of records returned in a report search" to the needed value. We recommend setting "No. of records per report page" to 50 or lower to reduce the loading time. 

2. You can turn off the client notification in the CAP policy so the user won't receive notifications:


3. If you create a denylist for applications, they will be blocked from opening completely. You can prevent transfers in those apps by creating a Block & Report CAP policy and select those apps from Exit Points. This way they can still be used for communication, only transfers will be blocked:


Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N89wv:ref
Subject: Issues with Several Settings    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N89wv:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000N89wv:ref

Hi Support

Have a nice day.

Thank you for your response. It seems we overthought Question 3...

Following up on Question 1, according to the user manual, when the report
exceeds 10,000 entries, it is possible to search using filters.

The current situation for the client is as follows:

   1. The MIS team has limited manpower.
   2. The company has set up multiple Groups.
   3. Each Group has its own manager, and *Manager A should not be able to
   view or manage Group B's data*.
   4. When an employee leaves the company, the manager checks the past six
   months of records in the system.

Based on the workflow, there are two key issues:
A. Before exporting to a CSV file, *how can Manager A view only logs
related to Group A*?
B. Is there a way to export CSV files separately based on Groups?
Thanks
Jay

Department administrators need to review the DC and CAP reports of former
employees within 6 months.

Thanks
Jay

TextBody:
Hi Jay,

Thank you for the additional details!
I checked, and unfortunately it's not possible to filter the logs by groups, and all EPP admins can see all logs.
Since they need to review the logs for ex employees, they can filter by their computer or username. 

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

From: Jay MAi [jay@epptw.com]
Sent: 3/21/2025 10:15 AM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #439429 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000N89wv:ref - Issues with Several Settings [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N89wv:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000N89wv:ref
 

Hi Support

 

Have a nice day.


Thank you for your response. It seems we overthought Question 3...

Following up on Question 1, according to the user manual, when the report exceeds 10,000 entries, it is possible to search using filters.

The current situation for the client is as follows:


	The MIS team has limited manpower.
	The company has set up multiple Groups.
	Each Group has its own manager, and Manager A should not be able to view or manage Group B's data.
	When an employee leaves the company, the manager checks the past six months of records in the system.


Based on the workflow, there are two key issues:
A. Before exporting to a CSV file, how can Manager A view only logs related to Group A?
B. Is there a way to export CSV files separately based on Groups?


Thanks
Jay

 


Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> ? 2025?3?20? ?? ??3:16???


Hello Jay,

Thanks for reaching out!

1. To increase the number of displayed items, please open the console and navigate to Device Control -> Global Settings


Scroll to the bottom of the page and set "Maximum no. of records returned in a report search" to the needed value. We recommend setting "No. of records per report page" to 50 or lower to reduce the loading time. 

2. You can turn off the client notification in the CAP policy so the user won't receive notifications:


3. If you create a denylist for applications, they will be blocked from opening completely. You can prevent transfers in those apps by creating a Block & Report CAP policy and select those apps from Exit Points. This way they can still be used for communication, only transfers will be blocked:


Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #439429 - - Issues with Several Settings [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N89wv:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Jay,

The Display Settings is the only one that might seem out of place, but it's set up this way because the settings apply the same hierarchy as the permissions in device control, and therefore many are interdependent. Also, this is the menu that our customers have been accustomed to for many years.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Hi Jay,

Thank you for the additional details!
I checked, and unfortunately it's not possible to filter the logs by groups, and all EPP admins can see all logs.
Since they need to review the logs for ex employees, they can filter by their computer or username.

Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> 於 2025年3月31日 週一 下午4:53寫道：

> Hello Jay,
>
> I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00439429. We haven’t
> heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need
> assistance with this issue.
>
> If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please
> let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the
> ticket on my end.
>
> Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions.
> We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.
>
> *Ticket Number:* 00439429
> *Ticket Subject:* Issues with Several Settings
> *Ticket Details:* Currently, the system log only displays 200 entries,
> even when set to show 500 entries (including Logs Report and others). It
> seems that there is no relevant setting in Default System Settings. How can
> this be adjusted?
>
> To prevent MS Office PST files from being taken out, we selected OUTLOOK
> under CAP Policy > File Type > Office Files. However, users receive
> frequent alerts every time they run Outlook. Besides setting Client Mode to
> Silent, do you have any other recommendations?
>
> Under Denylists > Applications, we can specify the application name, and
> Parameters allow additional configurations. Theoretically, using
> parameters, we should be able to block file transfers in WhatsApp while
> still allowing conversations. Is this correct?
>
> If (3) is correct, do you have parameters to prevent file transfers in
> Teams, LINE, WeChat, and WhatsApp?
>
> Thank you!
>
> Botond Biro
> Technical Support Engineer
> ____________________ _________
> *Cybersecurity That Works for You*
>
> 6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
> www.netwrix.com
